channel.title: CyberNetSec - Threat Actor
channel.description: Latest threat actor threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Hamas-Linked APT "Ashen Lepus" Targets Middle East with New "AshTag" Malware
item.description:
The Hamas-affiliated advanced persistent threat (APT) group known as Ashen Lepus (or WIRTE) is conducting an ongoing espionage campaign targeting governmental and diplomatic entities in the Middle East. Researchers have identified a new, modular .NET malware suite named AshTag being used in these at...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: "Operation DupeHike" Espionage Campaign Targets Russian Corporate HR Depts
item.description:
A highly targeted cyber-espionage campaign, dubbed "Operation DupeHike," has been identified targeting employees in Russian corporations. Attributed to the threat actor cluster UNG0902, the campaign uses convincing social engineering lures, such as decoy documents about employee bonuses, to infiltra...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Phishing, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: OPSEC Fail: North Korean Spy 'Trevor Greer' Exposed by Own Infostealer Infection
item.description:
In a major operational security (OPSEC) failure, a North Korean state-sponsored hacker was unmasked after accidentally infecting their own machine with commodity infostealer malware like LummaC2. The leaked logs, analyzed by Flashpoint and Hudson Rock, exposed the digital life of an operative using ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Threat Actor, Threat Intelligence, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: GrayBravo MaaS Fuels Cybercrime with CastleLoader Malware
item.description:
The cybercrime ecosystem is becoming more industrialized with the rise of Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) operations like 'GrayBravo.' According to Recorded Future's Insikt Group, GrayBravo is developing and distributing a sophisticated loader called CastleLoader to at least four separate threat cluster...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: DeadLock Ransomware Uses Vulnerable Baidu Driver to Blind EDRs
item.description:
A new DeadLock ransomware campaign is leveraging a novel "Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver" (BYOVD) loader to exploit a vulnerability (CVE-2024-51324) in a legitimate Baidu Antivirus driver, `BdApiUtil.sys`. This technique allows the threat actors to terminate any process, including endpoint detecti...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Malware, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Cl0p Implicated in Oracle Zero-Day Attacks, Breaching UPenn and University of Phoenix
item.description:
The University of Pennsylvania and the University of Phoenix have both reported data breaches resulting from the exploitation of zero-day vulnerabilities in their Oracle E-Business Suite servers. The attacks have compromised the personal information of at least 1,488 individuals at UPenn and a much ...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Actor, Vulnerability

Read Full Article →

item.title: WhatsApp Worm Spreads Astaroth Banking Trojan in New Brazilian Campaign
item.description:
A new malware campaign, tracked as STAC3150, is targeting banking users in Brazil by using WhatsApp Web as a distribution vector for the Astaroth banking trojan. The attack begins with a social engineering lure sent via WhatsApp, which persuades the victim to download a malicious ZIP archive. The ar...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Phishing, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: SharePoint Flaw Chain Exploited to Deploy Warlock Ransomware
item.description:
A new attack campaign attributed to the threat actor Storm-2603 is exploiting a chain of Microsoft SharePoint vulnerabilities (CVE-2025-49706, CVE-2025-49704) for initial access. Post-exploitation, the attackers deploy Velociraptor, a legitimate digital forensics and incident response (DFIR) tool, f...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Vulnerability, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Malicious Go Packages Impersonating Google UUID Library Steal Data
item.description:
A sophisticated and long-running supply chain attack targeting Go developers has been discovered, active since at least May 2021. The attack involves two malicious packages, `github.com/bpoorman/uuid` and `github.com/bpoorman/uid`, which impersonate a popular Google UUID library using a typosquattin...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Exposes 'BRICKSTORM' Backdoor Used by Chinese State Actors to Infiltrate US Government
item.description:
The US Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), NSA, and Canadian Centre for Cyber Security have jointly exposed a sophisticated backdoor named 'BRICKSTORM'. According to the December 4, 2025 advisory, People's Republic of China (PRC) state-sponsored actors are using this malware to ...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack
